S.FORM: iaku thuini pitu a tilhaz shaunasai lhupilhupishan a taun.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: amalhupishiza, itiza sa fuifuilh patashan a shinshii munai, lhupilhupishan a shanautuan mzai, “ilhilhi! pashungkitaz!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: matunaw malhinuna iamin zain, “shinshii maqitan uhu.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: pinfazaq iamin shinshii tata tusha turu lhupishan a Thau a lalawa ya lhmupish patashan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Thau language of numbers.

S.FORM: muntal iamin fuifuilh patashan a shinshii malhinuna, maqaquyash iamin tata, tusha, turu lhupishan a quyash.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: mafazaqiza iaku manasha wa Thau a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Thau languages.

S.FORM: tatata wa qali malhupish iaku, numa tatata wa qali minfazaq iaku sa Thau a lalawa, afuilh iaku naak a ina tunmaza.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Thau language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: naak a lhanaz zain Ilash.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Ilash。
My name is Ilash.

S.FORM: naak a ama wa lhanaz zain Umin.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Umin。
My dad’s name is Umin.

S.FORM: naak a ina wa lhanaz zain Apin.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Apin。
My mother’s name is Apin.

S.FORM: iaku thuini a kawash makthin a qamishan.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: itia naak a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut latata, thithu a lhanaz zain Tuba, thithu thuini a kawash makthin tata wa qamishan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Tuba，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Tuba, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: lhmupish iamin isa tataal a lhupilhupishan a taun.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: madaduu iaku numa naak a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut maqaquyash.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: madaduu iaku mrauz, ya pangqaiza wa qali, iamin tata wa taun musuun amutusi mrauz.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: mathuaw iaku mushnaw faqlhu a huruy, shduu iamin musuun maqaquyash numa mrauz.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: iaku tu Thau a azazak.
S.TRANSL: 我是邵族的小孩。
I am an Thau child.

S.FORM: naak a taun isai Baraubaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們家在日月村伊達邵。
Our family lives in Baraubaw.

S.FORM: iamin tata wa taun larima wa thau.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: itia iamin tata wa taun laturu a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: miasuun iaku naak a ama, ina, tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut numa tantuqash binanau’az a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: mathuaw marutaw naak a ama, numa maranash naak a ama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mathuaw mashiqarman naak a ina, numa riqariqaz shiz a shinshii naak a ina.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: naak a ama itaun mashthauthau mat itan ya malhinuna.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: iamin amakunakataunan ya pinangqaiza mahnariza wa qali.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: amusuun iamin smapuk sa bakbaki iaku numa naak a tantuqash a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我和我的兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: mathuaw iaku mushnaw tata taun a thau.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: iaku thuini masa naak a ina mutusi kilhnaqualh.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和我的媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: mathuaw dishlum shashanu a qali, qali antu mashimzaw antu mani mahnar, fari mathuaw mahaziwhiw.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: iamin milhungqu ipruq kmaan sa paang, patilhazin naam a buut, mathuaw maqalhuuz.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: saqaziza, qali mingqulhaiza.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: makikalhi iaku naak a ina, minu sa qali maqulhaqulha.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: ina mzai, amashiraus painan.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是要颱風了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: tanlhuaniza wa qali uka s urum, mu’apawiza sa kilhpuz.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: amushaiza ita mutaun mani.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: amutauniza isa saran, fuilh iaku sa kilhpuz mzai.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星說。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: mihala s qali ingqawan shmiraus, amuqthawan iaku mani musha malhalhiqash.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: naak a lhupilhupishan a taun isai naam a taun a shirshir, tatata wa qali iaku mundadaan ya mutusi lhupilhupishan a taun, numa mundadaan iaku mani makunataun.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ani naam a lhupilhupishan a taun mara’in muqay langqinunay, antu piza s lhmupishuan a azazak, mashtay mafazaq ya timatima.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: mashtay azazak mususuun isa lhupilhupishan a makakakri a danshiqan, mususuun matinhina sa maqarimusuz, numa musuun malhinuna.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: fuifuilh patashan a shinshii musuun iamin mani malhalhiqash, lhupilhupishan a taun miazai sa mara’in a taun.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: tatata wa qali iamin thmapu sa bukhaz, mashtay thmapu taun numa piatilaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: numa suma wa thau tmitish paziwat numa suma thmapu sa bukhaz.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: mashtay iamin thmapu lhupilhupishan a taun a pruq, pashtay mindahip thmapu lhupilhupishan a taun, numa tatata wa qali matilatilaw sa lhupilhupishan a taun.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: shitusi iaku tilha mriqaz naak a apura’in.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: mathuaw mindaaq iaku antu minriqaz naak a apura’in, mathuaw iaku mangqtuqtu thithu.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: naak a apura’in tu mriqaz iakin, pakaan iakin sharitunu numa piaqilha iakin pushawil.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃木瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to papaya and drink tea.

S.FORM: naak a apura’in pinalhuiza wa sharitunu mathuaw madahun, dadu mathuaw tauduu ya kaanin.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的木瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The papaya grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: mathuaw iaku miku iqilha naak a apura’in a pushawil, mathuaw maqitan iqilhan.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: ya saqazi, miasuun iaku naak a apuki’ay pinsaqazi iamin pit’ia.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: mathuaw naak a apuki’ay pinsaqazi pit’ia manasha pania’an, ianan rusaw, ianan ranaw, ianan bahat, numa ianan mani riaz.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有河蚌。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and clam.

S.FORM: kminaaniza kunsaqazi, musui tamakuan iamin mara shanglaw.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: mathuaw naak a apuki’ay lhai iakin buna, lhari numa tilkun, kathu mutaun.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: zaik thaithuy amushaiza iaku mutaun, ya ishawananiza iaku amuqthaiza iaku musui mriqaz thaithuy.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: thuini fuifuilh patashan a shinshii kmathu iamin musui ia’ianan numanuma wa lhkaribush a luluuman, itusi iamin pitaw mududur mitalha fariw sa qahil.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: mutusiza iamin ia’ianan numanuma wa lhkaribush a luluuman, fuifuilh patashan a shinshii mzai, “rumfaz itanamuqtha numa qlhuran itanarikus, shanamaniun mriqaz.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: shungkash iaku sa qlhuran, numawan ani iaku amariqaz qlhuran.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: iaku mriqaz rumfaz mathuaw manasha, thaithuy isui kawi mathuaw mafarfaz, mriqaz iaku mani shmadia malhus isai kawi a mabraq a itmaz.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ia’ianan numanuma wa lhkaribush a luluuman ianan sa thumay, tishmamraw numa rukzaw, ani iaku kahiwan mriqariqaz izai a lhkaribush, mathuaw iaku thuini maqaran tu mriqaz.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有熊、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: pashtiruq iaku manasha sa pinashtiruq pariqaz naak a ama ina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: amunai iaku musuun naak a ama ina ya kahiza.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: pangqaiza wa qali thuini, iaku masa naak a tantuqash binanau’az a minlhafut shitusi Tai-taang mriqaz naak a pan’amaan.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: iamin i Tai-paak milhungqu sa apuy a barimbin mutusi Tai-taang.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: shaunanaiza iamin Tai-taang, naak a pan’amaan patungbarimbin munai barimbin a pangqangqan mashduu iamin.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: barimbin a pangqangqan masa naak a pan’amaan a taun antu ihazish, ya patungbarimbin muhiaw shaunatantu.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: naak a pan’amaan a taun a shirshir itia mathuaw mara’ira’in a mara’in a buqan, musuun ita kmangqtha sa kangqthaan a barimbin mutantu mara’in a buqan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: isai mara’in a buqan, naak a pan’amaan makathu iamin pakaan sisi numa milhungqu sa tishmamraw.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: mahumhumiza, musuun iamin mutusi mawalhnaq a pruq makaan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: mathuaw manasha barimbin mawalhnaq a pruq, numawan matung’u-tu-bai iamin mutantu.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: numa amushaiza iamin, mriqaz iamin minu u-tu-bai qriuin suma, numawan milhungqu iamin sa basu musha.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: thuini iamin mutauniza iamin Tai-paak, tihauta iaku naak a pan’amaan a u-tu-bai qazii ya ungqtuaniza.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: kahiwan iaku inai Baraubaw tu langqinunayuan, minalhupishiza iaku, mungqthaiza iamin mutusi Tai-paak, miaqay iamin ininthawan isa mawalhnaq a pruq.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在日月村，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Baraubaw. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: numa minalhupishiza sa mara’in a lhupilhupishan, lhminupish iaku minfazaq miniahala inai a thau a kazakazash a minfazaq a patashan, mafazaqiza iaku Tai-waan miniahala inai a thau a qbit itia manasha wa numanuma wa kazakazash.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: numawan, thuini a pinangqaiza mahnariza wa qali, makunakataunan iaku numa naak a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut numa makikalhi iamin tanatuqash, mangqtu iamin minfazaq sa naam a Thau a kazakazash.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: haya tuqatuqash makashpashpatiza wa qamishan, numa riqazan sundaiza parhawaywan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: makikalhi iaku thithu mafazaq thithu numanuma wa lalawa, mathuaw thithu malhinuna Thau a lalawa mathuaw ma’ania, mafazaq mani thithu mashbunun a lalawa, numa Shpuut a lalawa numa Lit-puun a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的邵語說得很流利，也會說布農語、閩南話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Thau, as well as Bunun, Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: makikalhi iaku thithu, numa mafazaq iaku, maqa thithu minalhupish Lit-puun a lalawa tu azazakuan, tu Bunun a thau thithu a binanau’az, numa mathuaw thithu tu malhkakrikriw mathuaw kafazaqin thithu manasha Shpuut, numawan mafazaq thithu manasha antu tataal a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunu, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: musuun iamin malhalhinuna, numa izai tanatuqash fuilh manasha muribush a kazakazash.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: sharaqian antu shiruan iamin mafazaq sa mulhthkiz a lalawa, kanuniza pulaunin sa bahi iamin pasain sa ling-waa, shduu iamin muqtha tmaza.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: maura iaku mita wa Thau a kazakazash tu azazakuan, mayaw iaku mzai Thau mita.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: mafazaqiza iaku thuini Thau a numanuma wa kazakazash, mangqtu iaku mathuaw maqaran numa maqitan tu Thau iaku.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為邵族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Thau is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: thuini a saqaziza, amutauniza shashuaz ayuzi a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: mutusi iaku numa naak a apuki’ay farifariwan sa pania’an fariw sa ranaw, kuntanlhuan apintata iamin maqitan a akaanin pakaan naak a shashuaz ayuzi a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: mun’iutu iamin farifariwan shanglaw a taun, farifariwan shanglaw a taun itia manasha wa maqitaqitan a shanglaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: finariw iamin sangriz, sipu numa maqulha wa sai-puu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: isa shirshir farifariwan ribush a bunlhaz a taun a talima mzai, “mathuaw madahun naak a ung-lai numa qalup. fariwuan!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: finariw iamin ung-lai numa qalup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: mun’iutu iamin farifariwan bunlhaz a taun talima mzai, “numa sa afariwin uhu qa? mathuaw mara’in numa maramu thuini a ranaw, latata wa ranaw turu a shaba.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: naak a apuki’ay mzai mathuaw manasha tuali, zaiwan thithu talima putladadu sa tuali.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: kanuniza mzai s talima mathuaw ladadu a tuali, antu putladadu sa tuali.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: shirshir a talima mzai, “unaiwan fariw naak a rusaw, mathuaw mara’in numa ladadu a tuali naak a rusaw.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說:「來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。」
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: mingqarayza finariw iamin ranaw numa finariw iamin mani rusaw, numa mutaun pintata numa tata wa pangka manasha pania’an.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: mindaaq mitalha, minqusumiza sa qali.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: shashuaz ayuzi a minlhafut malhinuna sa ling-wa mzai, kanshitashan antu dai pangqa, amuqtha wa pangqaiza wa qali amutauniza.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: numa apuki’ay mzai, “pania’an mathuaw manasha, palalawa pashtay munai musuun kmaan!”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: malalawa iamin piathauthaun numa huruy, munai musuun kuntanlhuan kmaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: itia naak a tata wa tataal lhmupish a huruy zain Rungquan, miaqay min’a’aura kmathu thithu a aniamin.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Rungquan，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Rungquan, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: ya malhupish miaqay thithu mashimul tataal lhmupish a huruy patatash, tatitish numa patashan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: mutal, mupushaz, muturuz, mashtay pashimul thithu aniamin.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: numa maqa maqarman thithu minzawash miaqay mashimul antu pushuqish thithu.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: mingqarayza mashtay antu pashimul thithu aniamin.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: tata wa qali, mashtay iamin musuun mutusi kilhnaqualh.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: makuntusi iamin isa saran, apishtupuan sa Rungquan, numa min’aura thithu kmathu sa qahil.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Rungquan想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Rungquan wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: amashimul thithu huruy qahil, zain thithu a huruy mzai, “ani iaku mani kminathu”
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說:「我也沒有帶耶。」
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: numa izai Rungquan minsasalpu numa thmanit. minbuqnur thithu mzai, “minuiza pashtay maniun antu pashimul iakin qahil !”
S.TRANSL: Rungquan急的哭了出來。他生氣的說:「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!」
Rungquan burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tataal lhmupish a huruy fuilh thithu, maqa miaqay ihu antu min’ananak makathu sa qahil, numa ihu ya shimimul numanuma antu pushuqish!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: simaqiza malhupish iamin, Rungquan mathuaw matinhumhum mutusi lhupilhupishan a taun, thithu shmimul a numanuma pulhthkizin pushuqish lhai sa tataal lhmupish a huruy.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Rungquan很早就到學校了，Rungquan把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Rungquan arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Rungquan mathuaw amazayza thithu a tataal lhmupish a huruy, numa fuilh thaithuy dai ya kahiza thithu amin’ananak kmathu numanuma aniamin, numa anuniza thaithuy sa tataal lhmupish a huruy pashimul thithu aniamin.
S.TRANSL: Rungquan向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Rungquan apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: kataunan a muribush a thau naak a ama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: tu azazakuan iaku, naak a ama numa pan’amaan mutusi hudun ya tanlhuan, kmathu thaithuy sa funush numa puthuum.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: ya shashanuiza, kmathu thaithuy mara sa matiqtu a lhkaribush makunataun.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: ya tu suma wazish, ya tu suma rawaz, itia mani sa alhua masa lhizashan.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: mapa’inqbit thaithuy lhkaribush a bunlhaz isai kataunan a pitaw, patara thaithuy suma wa thau.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: miaqay iaku miku untal naak a ama muribush.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: naak a ama mzai ya mara’iniza amakathu iakin muntal muribush.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: kataunan a ayuzi mafazaq mani kmalawa sa tuqris, putuqris numa kmalawa qadup thaithuy ya muribush.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會放吊陷和設置石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: mathuaw naak a ama ma’ania tmuqris, ama mzai, “haya wa tuqris apuqtu sa alhua, amariqaz iamin lhkaribush a sapaz, numa atmuqris iamin pisui sinaranan lhkaribush.”
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會設置吊陷，爸爸說:「這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，然後將吊陷放在獵物走過的路上。」

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: mangqtu iaku muhiaw muntal parhaway numa tanatuqash mutusi hudun muribush, numawan tatata wa qali minfazaq iaku kmalawa sa tuqris, amuhiaw naak a tuqris shduu mara sa lhkaribush.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: minriqaz naak a ama iakin mzai, “aminma’ania wa muribush a thau ihu ya kahiza.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說:「我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。」
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: mara’iniza iaku thuini, mapa iaku naak a futulh numa lhpazishan muntal naak a ama iakin musui muribush.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: mutaun iamin kataunan ya itia matiqtu sa lhkaribush patara pakaan suma wa thau.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: ama mzai apaplish iamin, piakalingkin maniun mulhthkiz tanatuqash, mathuaw maqitan pimbahi iamin muribush mara manasha wa lhkaribush.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: mutusi iaku malhupish shashanu saqazian.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: mutusi iaku lhupilhupishan a taun, min’aura iaku kminathu sa antutuan patashan.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: numanuma wa aniamin antu kminathu iaku.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: ya lhmupish, iaku miasuun naak a tataal lhmupish a huruy mriqaz sa patashan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: ya mutazam, tataal lhmupish a huruy shimulik sa patatash numa tatitish.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: fuifuilh patashan a shinshii mzai, “milhhumhum ya muqthawan, niza tu saqazian!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, \Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!\""

S.FORM: naak a maqitan a huruy mzai Huqu, Thau a azazak thithu mani.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Huqu，他也是邵族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Huqu, and he is also an Thau child.

S.FORM: miasuun iamin isa Baraubaw a kataunan lhmupish.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Baraubaw部落讀書。
We study together in the Baraubaw tribe.

S.FORM: miarain miasuun iamin tunmaza apu malhinuna kahiwan a lalawa, mathuaw ma’ania iamin ya malhinuna Thau a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說邵語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Thau proficiently.

S.FORM: mathuaw marutaw iaku mani maramu, mathuaw Huqu matumpiq mani mashiqarman.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Huqu很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Huqu is short and thin.

S.FORM: Huqu mathuaw ma’aluz’uz, pashtay madaduu thithu.
S.TRANSL: Huqu很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Huqu is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: lhupilhupishan a taun pinkazakaza sa buut a makakakri thuini, lhupilhupishan a taun kmalawa piza wa qbit malantatnur.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: ianan sa shmuruz klhiw, psaq qarimusuz, malalia, minparaw, kmulhpazishan.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: malantatnur iaku malalia.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: malalia iaku taubukbuk, mathuaw qaruf paktalhum.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: kanuniza milhilhi iaku, muqthawan makunamuqtha malalia.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: shaunapispis iaku, pashtay a thau mathuaw ma’alah’a.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: sharaqian antu mara sa makintata, kanuniza mathuaw ma’alah’a iaku, maqa mukaktuniza iaku malantatnur.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: minuntal iaku naak a ama tilha mriqaz naak a pan’amaan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: pan’amaan a kuskus siangiza
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: mzai thithu iamin, taun a tafuq ianan latata wa tabraqan.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: kashiqitan thithu sa tafuq, initafuq panthathak panapruq.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: ama kminathu sa qnuan a bunlhaz masa shawiki lhai pan’amaan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: iaku masa pan’amaan isa laqup malhalhinuna, mathuaw mzai thithu manasha sa kahiwan a lalawa patmazan iakin.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: amushaiza iaku, numa pan’amaan lhumfaan iakin mzai minrutawiza numa mindirudiruiza.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: zaik “pan’amaan a kuskus ya minqitaniza, muqthawan munai naak a taun kilhnaqualh.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: isa 2022 wa kawash, zing-huu pishfazaq miniahala inai a thau sa thau a tnuran shduuiza muqayza matash sa thau a qbit a lhanaz.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: iaku makikalhi sa mathuaw munsai zing-huu thmaduq mindaaq sa thau a tnuran muqayza matash sa thau a qbit a lhanaz kataunan a parhaway Panu.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Panu。
I interviewed Panu, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: amatilhduu iaku thithu inai pangqaiza wa qali mutusi thithu a taun makikalhi thithu.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: makikalhi thithu tu isisua, thithu pishfazaq iakin miakuza thithu a lhanaz minakanai, numa kmathu iakin mani mafazaq sa thithu a taun a thau, numa thithu a kataunan.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: makikalhi iaku thithu minu amingqtha sa lhanaz, sasaz a pinatash antu tauduu qa?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: thithu muntazaikin mzai, maqa pasain Shpuut a matash antu pubalabalay pishfazaq thithu a lhanaz, suma wa thau amalalawa thithu mzai “Pa shinshii.” numawan kafazaan suma.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Panu mzai, “miniahala inai a thau matash a lhanaz shunda sa naam a lhanaz, naak a lhanaz mia’azu naam a thau a qbit, naam a taun a qbit, naam a tnuran, mangqtu ianan manasha sa thau a qbit apushuqish ananak a lhanaz.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Panu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: tilha muntal iaku naak a apuki’ay musui farifariwan pashatalha sa aniamin, kathun apuki’ay manasha mat’anak malhuyza wa shanglaw mu’iutu, numa kmalawa miniahala inai a thau maqitan a akaanin lhai pashta.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: pashtay miku apuki’ay a pashatalha’an, makamun numa lhari manasha sa thau finariw, manasha sa thau munai kmaan pintatan thithu a pania’an.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和芋頭很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and taro, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: thithu sa pintatan a tazakas numa sunda wa afu mathuaw maqitan ya kaanin, numa ianan pasain rafun masa rumrum puqana’an, shmurawath shazik manasha sa kilhnaqualh a thau, pashta mulhthkiz munai naam a pashatalha’an mududur.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多遊客，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: apuki’ay ya pintata sa aniamin, ishirshir iaku malalawa kilhnaqulh a thau. ishirshir minbabaw iaku mzai az’az mat’anak iamin malhuiza wa shanglaw, min’ananak maqitan, uhiawan munai fariw!
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: naam a aniamin muhiaw fariwiniza, apuki’ay mzai, “maqa ianan ihu tu mindahip.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: izai a makakakri, mafazaq iaku sa izai miniahala inai a thau a pinalhuiza numa kakaanin a infazaqin, numa ananak shmuzap pashatalha sa aniamin a shkuda.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: mriqaz naak a apuki’ay mathuaw miku sa kahiwan a kakaanin, mathuaw iaku pazazai numa matingqaran.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和高興。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
